ratings.comment: Definitely not my favorite class. Lots of supplemental materials and assignments you don't need to do. Tests and paper is easy. However, it was really hard for me to want to go to class. Dr. Wink is very monotone with a thick accent. There are also no slides to go with lectures. The only think you should buy is the Empire book
This professor was very clear and goes in depth with what he presents in lecture. However the lectures can be dull. I skipped a lot and got an A by doing readings and attending the discussions.

Does not use a powerpoint during lectures, so it is easy to doze off and not pay attention. He is a very smart guy and knows a lot about what he is talking about, but it is hard to pay attention during lecture. Class is an easy A if you do the readings and pay a bit of attention during class.

Professor Wink really likes to listen to himself talk; he is a very old-school, chalkboard type with a thick, but understandable, accent. To eek out a passing grade, you either need to do the readings or show up to lecture, but not both. Most of the concepts are described abstractly rather than specifics, which is part of what makes the easy grade.
Bought the book but really didn't need to use it, he summarized it during every lecture (although the power lectures were very difficult to get through). One 6-8 page book review and one midterm

Worst class I've ever taken at UW. He never responded to emails, and never had office hours. Only two grades in the entire class, two groups of 4 mini essays. However, no guidelines were given and then we were graded harshly. Unrealistic amount of reading (had to buy 10 books from Amazon). Lectures were dry/disorganized, it was hard to stay awake.

Professor Wink's lectures could be a little dry at times but getting an A in this class was really easy. There is one midterm, one paper, and the final. For the two tests he gives you a study guide and takes the test from the study guide. Recommend taking to get an easy A.

One midterm, one final, one paper. Overall a great lecturer, as he gives very clear information with a lot of dates (which are useful on exams) and has a very interesting (but still completely understandable) accent. Deep knowledge of history.  Textbooks assigned are really easy and interesting reads. Would definitely recommend.

easiest class i've ever taken. Professor Wink pulls most of his lecture from the books so there's no point to read them and he gives all the test questions prior to the test. His lectures are fairly boring but are sometimes interesting or comical

Overall, I really liked this class. It had a lot of interesting things and a lot of ideas that I hadn't really encountered. The reading wasn't too bad, books weren't expensive. My only real complaint was that it felt like a few times when the grading seemed a little stiff. I got a high AB on both the exam and the book review, but overall solid prof

Really easy class if you pay attention in lecture. Straight to the point, generally cares for his students. One paper, midterm, and final, but final is not cumulative. Also only need 24 books he assigns. Not much work for a history class

Took his 130 class for humanities credit.  He's a good lecturer, but that's all he does. It really depends on your TA for additional understanding. No outside of class assignments, but you should read whats in the syllabus. Graded based on midterm, final and one paper. Very old-school professor.
Laid back and generally fairly interesting. Super easy.

He knows a lot about the history of Southeast Asia. That being said, he is not open to any new information and/or ideas. He is arrogant and believes he knows everything. I went to every lecture and actually read the book and he gave me horrible grades...
His lectures are exceedingly boring to the point that I can't remember a class when I I did not fall asleep. That being said, the class is not all that hard.

This man's voice is a lullaby, that will get you nodding off.  That being said, he is extremely knowledgable and shows passion about his subject. His accent is cool.  He is funny at times to.  Textbook was helpful.  Gives you no idea what you need to do to get an A.  Tests are easy though.

Nice professor with interesting perspective (from the Netherlands) and very informative on south asia. Unfortunately the TA has all of the control when it comes to your grade. Exams are 3 or 4 questions and always material that is covered in class or textbook. Take classes by him, just hope for a fair TA.
pretty chill, has a cool accent, wears designer jeans. knowledgable. your grade depends on your ta.

Nice guy, lectures can get boring/tiring. Long-winded talker, but will help if you ask, he's quite accomodating with office hours, etc. He does not quite abit about the subject, after all he's the only south-asian professor here!

Nice guy but his voice will soothe you to sleep.  Don't need to go to lecture because your grade is all about what the TA wants you to know.  The book is interesting/helpful for the essay.  Tests are easy.  Easy A.

He's not the most entertaining, but he's better than others. Lectures follow book readings, but in less detail. Your grade will depend 98% on your TA, not Wink! High-Power TA = not so easy 100-level class...
Great professor.  Presents the material in a lecture fashion that can get boring after a while.  Tests are relatively easy.
Interesting and humerous.  I went to every power lecture for this class and didn't mind it.  Tests were very reasonable.  Do the reading and you will have nothing to worry about.

He is difficult to listen to for an hour.  A slight sense of humor, but droans on and on...tests were ok.  I attended about 60% of classes and pulled an AB off, but did lots of reading and studying for the written exams.
